full_text:
Creating payments and reserves

Lesson
objectives

* Create and modify reserves

¢ Create payments

* Create payments with multiple payees and
payments

The business of adjudicating claims takes
the claim from intake all the way to paying
the claimant for covered losses. As an
adjuster, | need to know how to create
payments against the correct coverage
and apply deductibles when required.

Tanvi

Adjuster \ee/

| Reserves review fa
oO Coverage: Workers’ Comp
e3 Claimant: Jim Means
= @
es Reserve Line 1 (Medical Details)

Cost type: Claim Cost
Cost category: Medical

Reserve Line 2 (Medical Details)
Cost type: Expense
Cost category: Case management

« Areserve line is an amount of money set aside for expected payments related to a given exposure
* Reserve transactions are the credits and debits against a reserve line

* Reserve lines are uniquely defined by exposure, cost type, and cost category

original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| What is a check? G

Checks are transfers of funds to a claimant or other third party co
Funds come from one or more reserve lines =f

in
Checks may be ‘checks’ or Electronic Funds Transfers (EFTs) == ae aE

&
Checks may be to one or more parties D4 Bn

Checks may be for one or more payments { o} oy
Checks are always part of a CheckSet =)

| Automatic payments (recurring payments) Gi

¢ The Check wizard allows creation of automatic future payments
¢ Specify frequency and number of checks
* Service period is the timeframe this set of checks covers

« When the second-to-last check is submitted, an activity for two days before the last
check is created

¢ The activity is a reminder that the payment stream is ending

ClaimCenter Processing
System

ClaimCenter does not write checks or issue Electronic Funds Transfers
ClaimCenter uses an integration point to an external check processing system
This system prints paper checks and/or manages Electronic Funds Transfers

Information exchange
+ ClaimCenter sends check data (amount, line items, ...)

+ ClaimCenter receives the check status (such as requesting or issued)

| Demonstration G

Issuing payments

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Student exercise

Creating payments

Question G

_~ — Betty Baker went through the payment wizard one time. She specified
oo three payees (and there were no joint payees or recurring payments).
¢ Based on this information alone:
A. Can you tell how many CheckSets there are?
B. Can you tell how many checks there are?

c. Can you tell how many payment transactions there are?

SS oe ooo e eo oe ooooOoD

Answer ia

_~ — Betty Baker went through the payment wizard one time. She specified
o three payees (and there were no joint payees or recurring payments).
¢ Based on this information alone:

A. Can you tell how many CheckSets there are? Yes. There is one.
(Each iteration of the payment wizard creates one checkset.)

B. Can you tell how many checks there are? Yes. There are three.
(Unless there are joint payees, each payee has a separate check.
Unless there are recurring checks, then for three payees, there
must be three checks.)

c. Can you tell how many payment transactions there are? No. You can't
tell. (The number of payment transactions is not tied to the
number of payees.)

SSS eee oe eo ooo e SoD

Question

,- — Acheck includes a $200 final payment from a $500 reserve line. Why
¢ does ClaimCenter create a second transaction? What is the dollar

“ amount of this transaction?

SS oe ooo e eo oe ooooOoD

Gi

Answer ia

,- — Acheck includes a $200 final payment from a $500 reserve line. Why
o does ClaimCenter create a second transaction? What is the dollar
: amount of this transaction?

The second transaction is used to zero out the reserve line. The dollar amount of this
transaction will be -$300, since there is $300 remaining after the $200 payment
transaction.

SSS eee oe eo ooo e SoD

Question

,~ — Inwhat status must a check be for a user to delete the check?

¢
4
¢

SS oe ooo e eo oe ooooOoD

Answer

,~ — Inwhat status must a check be for a user to delete the check?
¢
4
4

Awaiting submission

SSS eee oe eo ooo e SoD

Question

,7~ — Can you start the payment wizard when the claim is not at “ability to
7 pay"? Why?

¢

SS oe ooo e eo oe ooooOoD

Gi

Answer ia

,7~ — Can you start the payment wizard when the claim is not at “ability to
7 pay"? Why?

¢

No. Validation rules prevent you from starting the payment wizard if the claim is not at
“ability to pay".

SSS eee oe eo ooo e SoD

Lesson
obj ectives * Create and modify reserves
review * Create payments

* Create payments with multiple payees and
payments
